data.title: Four-Color Maps
data.statement:
Regions on an [[N]] by [[N]] map will be colored <<red>> ({{R}}), <<green>> ({{G}}), <<blue>> ({{B}}), or <<yellow>> ({{Y}}). Regions of different color are adjacent if they share a common border. Areas are not considered to connect diagonally.

One contiguous region, marked with {{?}} as <<uncolored>>, will be completely surrounded by 3 of the 4 colors named. Find the other color that can be used to fill in this region, such that all adjacent regions are of a different color. There will always be a single [[choice]] for {{?}}.

testCases.title: Tiny
testCases.testIn:
3
G G G
G ? R
Y Y R

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
3
R R G
R ? G
B B B

data.constraints:
3 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
The <<uncolored>> symbol {{?}} does not appear on edges.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N loopline N color:word(1)
write choice
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the size of the map
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> The [[color]] for each unit area (of which there are [[N]] in the row) separated by spaces
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> One of {{R}}, {{G}}, {{B}}, or {{Y}} as the [[choice]] of color for {{?}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Regions on an N by N map will be colored red (R), green (G), blue (B), or yellow (Y). Regions of different color are adjacent if they share a common border. Areas are not considered to connect diagonally.

One contiguous region, marked with ? as uncolored, will be completely surrounded by 3 of the 4 colors named. Find the other color that can be used to fill in this region, such that all adjacent regions are of a different color. There will always be a single choice for ?.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the size of the map
Next N lines: The color for each unit area (of which there are N in the row) separated by spaces
Output
Line 1: One of R, G, B, or Y as the choice of color for ?
Constraints
3 ≤ N ≤ 10
The uncolored symbol ? does not appear on edges.
Example
Input
3
G G G
G ? R
Y Y R
Output
B
